methods.documentation: GetVirtualVolumeCount enables you to retrieve the number of virtual volumes currently in the system.
methods.name: GetVirtualVolumeCount
ListVirtualVolumeBindings
methods.documentation: ListVirtualVolumeBindings returns a list of all virtual volumes in the cluster that are bound to protocol endpoints.

params.name: virtualVolumeBindingIDs
params.documentation: A list of virtual volume binding IDs for which to retrieve information. If you omit this parameter, the method returns information about all virtual volume bindings.

methods.name: ListVirtualVolumeHosts
methods.documentation: ListVirtualVolumeHosts returns a list of all virtual volume hosts known to the cluster. A virtual volume host is a  ESX® host that has initiated a session with the VASA API provider.

params.name: virtualVolumeHostIDs
params.documentation: A list of virtual volume host IDs for which to retrieve information. If you omit this parameter, the method returns information about all virtual volume hosts.

methods.name: ListVirtualVolumeTasks
methods.documentation: ListVirtualVolumeTasks returns a list of virtual volume tasks in the system. This method does not remove completed tasks from the system.

params.name: virtualVolumeTaskIDs
params.documentation: A list of virtual volume task IDs for which to retrieve information. If you omit this parameter, the method returns information about all virtual volume tasks.

methods.name: ListVolumeStatsByVirtualVolume
methods.documentation: ListVolumeStatsByVirtualVolume enables you to list statistics for volumes, sorted by virtual volumes.

params.name: startVirtualVolumeID
params.documentation: The ID of the virtual volume at which to begin the list.

params.name: virtualVolumeIDs
params.documentation: A list of virtual volume  IDs for which to retrieve information. If you specify this parameter, the method returns information about only these virtual volumes.

members.documentation: The number of virtual volumes currently in the system.
members.name: count

members.documentation: A list of objects describing all virtual volumes in the cluster that are bound to protocol endpoints.
members.name: bindings

members.documentation: A list of objects describing the virtual volume hosts in the cluster.
members.name: hosts

members.documentation: A list of objects describing the virtual volume tasks currently in the system.
members.name: tasks

members.documentation: A list of objects detailing statistics for each volume associated with a virtual volume.
members.name: volumeStats

types.documentation: The virtual volume binding object contains  information about a virtual volume's binding. You can retrieve a list of this information for all virtual volumes using the ListVirtualVolumeBindings API method.
types.name: bindingVV

members.documentation: The unique ID of the protocol endpoint.
members.name: protocolEndpointID

members.documentation: The scsiNAADeviceID of the protocol endpoint. For more information, see protocolEndpoint.
members.name: protocolEndpointInBandID

members.documentation: The type of protocol endpoint. SCSI is the only value returned for the protocol endpoint type.
members.name: protocolEndpointType

members.documentation: The unique ID of the virtual volume binding object.
members.name: virtualVolumeBindingID

members.documentation: The unique ID of the virtual volume host.
members.name: virtualVolumeHostID

members.documentation: The unique ID of the virtual volume.
members.name: virtualVolumeID

members.documentation: The secondary ID of the virtual volume.
members.name: virtualVolumeSecondaryID

members.documentation: An object describing the bound volume or snapshot.
members.name: virtualVolume

members.documentation: An object describing the protocol endpoint to which the virtual volume is bound.
members.name: protocolEndpoint

members.documentation: An object describing the host to which this binding corresponds.
members.name: virtualVolumeHost

types.documentation: The virtual volume host object contains  information about a virtual volume host. You can use theListVirtualVolumeHosts method to retreive this information for all virtual volume hosts.
types.name: hostVV

members.documentation: A list of objects describing the bindings for the virtual volume host.
members.name: bindings

members.documentation: The unique ID of the cluster this host is associated with.
members.name: clusterID

members.documentation: The IP address or DNS name of the virtual volume host.
members.name: hostAddress

members.documentation: A list of initiator IQNs for the virtual volume host.
members.name: initiatorNames

members.documentation: The unique ID of this virtual volume host.
members.name: virtualVolumeHostID

members.documentation: A list of protocol endpoint IDs visible on this host.
members.name: visibleProtocolEndpointIDs

members.documentation: The unique ID of the virtual volume host.
members.name: hostGuid

members.documentation: The unique ID of the cluster to which the virtual volume host belongs.
members.name: hostClusterGuid

members.documentation: A list of the visible protocol endpoints.
members.name: protocolEndpoints

types.documentation: The virtual volume task object contains  information about a currently running or finished virtual volume task in the system. You can use the ListVirtualVolumeTasks method to retrieve this information for all virtual volume tasks.
types.name: taskVV

members.name: asyncHandle
members.documentation: The asyncHandle associated with the task.
Indicates whether or not the task was cancelled. Possible values:truefalse
members.name: cancelled

members.documentation: The unique virtual volume ID of the virtual volume being cloned (for clone tasks).
members.name: cloneVirtualVolumeID

members.documentation: An object containing metadata of the parent for tasks which clone or take snapshots of a virtual volume.
members.name: parentMetadata

members.documentation: The total space available (in bytes) on the parent for clone or snapshot tasks.
members.name: parentTotalSize

members.documentation: The used space of the parent (in bytes) for clone or snapshot tasks
members.name: parentUsedSize

members.documentation: The type of operation the task is performing. Possible values:unknown: The task operation is unknown.prepare: The task is preparing a virtual volume.snapshot: The task is creating a snapshot of a virtual volume.rollback: The task is rolling back a virtual volume to a snapshot.clone: The task is creatinga clone of the virtual volume.fastClone: The task is creating a fast clone of a virtual volume.copyDiffs: The task is copying differing blocks to a virtual volume.
members.name: operation

members.documentation: The current status of the virtual volume task:Error: The task has failed and returned an error.Queued: The task is waiting to be run.Running: The task is currently running.Success: Thetask has completed successfully.
members.name: status

members.documentation: The unique ID of the host that started the task.
members.name: virtualVolumeHostID

members.documentation: The new, unique virtual volume ID (for tasks that create a new virtual volume).
members.name: virtualVolumeID

members.documentation: The unique ID of the task.
members.name: virtualVolumeTaskID

types.documentation: The virtualVolume object contains configuration information about a virtual volume as well as information about snapshots of the virtual volume. It does not include runtime or usage information. You can use the ListVirtualVolumes method to retrieve some or all of the Virtual Volume objects for the cluster.
types.name: virtualVolume

members.documentation: A list of binding IDs for this virtual volume.
members.name: bindings

members.documentation: A list of virtual volume UUIDs that are children of this virtual volume.
members.name: children

members.documentation: When "recursive=true" is passed to the ListVirtualVolumes method, contains a list of virtual volume UUIDs that are descendants of this virtual volume.
members.name: descendants

members.documentation: Key / value pairs of the virtual volume’s metadata, such as virtual volume type, guest OS type, and so on.
members.name: metadata

members.documentation: The virtualVolumeID of the parent virtual volume.     If the ID is all zeros, this is an independent virtual volume with no link to a parent.
members.name: parentVirtualVolumeID

members.documentation: The ID of the underlying  snapshot. '0' value if the virtual volume does not represent asnapshot.
members.name: snapshotID

members.documentation: The snapshot object for the associated snapshot (null if nonixestent).
members.name: snapshotInfo

members.documentation: Current status of the virtual volume:cloning: The virtual volume is being processed in response to a clone or snapshot operation.waiting: The virtual volume is waiting for a snapshot operation to complete.ready: The virtual volume is ready for general purpose use.
members.name: status

members.documentation: An object describing the storage container that owns this virtual volume.
members.name: storageContainer

members.documentation: The unique ID of the virtual volume.
members.name: virtualVolumeID

members.documentation: The type of the virtual volume.
members.name: virtualVolumeType

members.documentation: The ID of the underlying volume.
members.name: volumeID

members.documentation: When "details=true" is passed to the ListVirtualVolumes method, this member is an object describing the volume.
members.name: volumeInfo

members.documentation: The size, in bytes, of the addressable space of the virtual volume.
members.name: volumeLogicalSize

members.documentation: The size, in bytes, of the actual space occupied by the virtual volume.
members.name: volumeCommittedSize

types.documentation: The snapshot object contains information about a snapshot made for a  volume.You can use the ListSnapshots API method to retrieve a list of snapshot information for a volume or for all volumes. The response includes information about the active snapshot as well as each snapshot created for a volume.
types.name: snapshot

members.documentation: A small string representation of the data in the stored snapshot. This checksum can be used later to compare other snapshots to detect errors in the data.
members.name: checksum

members.documentation: UTC+0 formatted time the snapshot was created.
members.name: createTime

members.documentation: Identifies if snapshot is enabled for remote replication.
members.name: enableRemoteReplication

members.documentation: Indicates how the snapshot expiration was set. Possible values:Api: The expiration time was set by using the API. None: There is no expiration time set.Test: The expiration time was set for testing.
members.name: expirationReason

members.documentation: The time at which this snapshot will expire and be purged from the cluster.
members.name: expirationTime

members.documentation: Group ID if the snapshot is a member of a group snapshot.
members.name: groupID

members.documentation: The current “members” results contains information about each snapshot in the group.Each of these members will have a “uuid” parameter for the snapshot’s UUID.
members.name: groupsnapshotUUID

members.documentation: Unique name assigned to the snapshot. If no name was specified, the name is the UTC+0 formatted time stamp of when the snapshot was created.
members.name: name

members.documentation: Current remote status of the snapshot.Possible values: Present: The snapshot exists on a remote cluster.NotPresent: The snapshot does not exist on remote cluster.Syncing: This is a target cluster and it is currently replicating the snapshot.Deleted: This is a target cluster, the snapshot has been deleted, and it still exists onthe source.
members.name: remoteStatus

members.documentation: Unique ID of an existing snapshot.
members.name: snapshotID

members.documentation: Universal Unique ID of an existing snapshot.
members.name: snapshotUUID

members.documentation: Current status of the snapshot:unknown: There was an error obtaining the status of the snapshot.preparing: This snapshot is being prepared for use and is not yet writable.remoteSyncing: This snapshot is being replicated from a remote cluster.done: This snapshot has finished preparation or replication and is now usable.active: This snapshot is the active branch.cloning: This snapshot is involved in a CopyVolume operation.
members.name: status

members.documentation: Total bytes of the snapshot.
members.name: totalSize

members.documentation: The ID of the virtual volume associated with this snapshot.
members.name: virtualVolumeID

members.documentation: The Volume ID the snapshot was created from.
members.name: volumeID

types.documentation: The protocolEndpoint object contains the attributes of a protocol endpoint. You can retrieve this information for all protocol endpoints in the cluster using the API method ListProtocolEndpoints.
types.name: protocolEndpoint

members.documentation: The ID of the primary protocol endpoint provider object for the protocol endpoint.
members.name: primaryProviderID

members.documentation: The unique ID of the protocol endpoint.
members.name: protocolEndpointID

members.documentation: The status of the protocol endpoint. Possible values:Active: The protocol endpoint is in use.Start: The protocol endpoint is starting.Failover: The protocol endpoint has failed over.Reserved: The protocol endpoint is reserved.
members.name: protocolEndpointState

members.documentation: The type of the protocol endpoint's provider. Possible values:PrimarySecondary
members.name: providerType

members.documentation: The globally unique SCSI device identifier for the protocol endpoint in NAA IEEE Registered Extended Format.
members.name: scsiNAADeviceID

members.documentation: The ID of the secondary protocol endpoint provider object for the protocol endpoint.
members.name: secondaryProviderID

types.documentation: The storageContainer object contains the attributes of a virtual volume storage container. You can retrieve this information for  each storage container in the cluster using the API method ListStorageContainers.
types.name: storageContainer

members.documentation: The ID of the account associated with the storage container.
members.name: accountID

members.documentation: The CHAP authentication secret for the initiator associated with the storage container.
members.name: initiatorSecret

members.documentation: The name of the storage container.
members.name: name

members.documentation: The storage container's protocol endpoint type. SCSIis the only value returned for the protocol endpoint type.
members.name: protocolEndpointType

members.documentation: The status of the storage container. Possible values:Active: The storage container is in use.Locked: The storage container is locked.
members.name: status

members.documentation: The unique ID of the storage container.
members.name: storageContainerID

members.documentation: The CHAP authentication secret for the target associated with the storage container.
members.name: targetSecret

members.documentation: A list of the virtual volumes associated with the storage container.
members.name: virtualVolumes
